holidays.description: New Year’s Day is the first day of the year, or January 1, in the Gregorian calendar.

holidays.name: Valentine's Day
holidays.description: February 14 is Valentine's Day or Saint Valentine's Feast. The day of love owes its origins to ancient Roman and European Christian traditions.

holidays.name: Shab-e-Meraj
holidays.description: Isra and Mi'raj (Isra Me'raj, Israa and Mi'raaj, Laylat Al-Isra wa Al-Miraj, Lailat al Miraj, Night Journey and Ascension to Heaven) marks the night that the Prophet Mohammad traveled from Mecca to Jerusalem, ascended to heaven and returned.

holidays.name: Holi
holidays.description: Holi is a spring festival of colors celebrated by Hindus, Sikhs and others. It celebrates the triumph of good over evil and the upcoming season of spring. The festival can last up to sixteen days.

holidays.description: Shab e-Barat is a government holiday in Bangladesh

holidays.name: Maundy Thursday
holidays.description: Maundy Thursday is a Christian observance on the Thursday during Holy Week. It is the day before Good Friday.

holidays.name: Good Friday
holidays.description: Good Friday is a global Christian observance two days before Easter Sunday.

holidays.name: Holy Saturday
holidays.description: Holy Saturday is the day before Easter Sunday.

holidays.name: Easter Day
holidays.description: Easter Sunday commemorates Jesus Christ’s resurrection, according to Christian belief.

holidays.name: Eid ul-Fitr
holidays.description: Eid al-Fitr is a holiday to mark the end of the Islamic month of Ramadan, during which Muslims fast during the hours of daylight.

holidays.name: Eid al-Adha
holidays.description: Eid al-Adha (Id ul-Adha) is an Islamic festival falling on the 10th day of the month of Dhul Hijja (Thou al-Hijja) to commemorate the willingness of Ibrahim (Abraham) to sacrifice his son.
